column1: '''Fréa''' ([[Third Age]] 2570 – 2659, aged 89 years) was the fourth of the Kings of [[Rohan]].

Fréa the great-grandson of [[Eorl the Young]], and succeeded the long-lived [[Aldor]]. He was already seventy-five years old when he came to the throne. His fourteen-year reign is recorded as one of peace and prosperity.<ref name="Mark">{{App

column2: Frēa]]'' is one of the words for "lord". It is also related to the [[Norse]] name "Freyr". The element appears also in the names [[Fréaláf]] and [[Fréawine]].

column1: Fréan is also the name that [[Eriol]] gave to the Valar in his Old English "translation" of the ''[[Quenta Silmarillion]]''.<ref>{{SM
